byline.contributor: Matthew Goldstein and Julie Creswell contributed reporting.

abstract: United States authorities arrest Samuel Mebiame, adviser for hedge fund Och-Ziff Capital Management Group, on bribery charges; he is charged with paying bribes to foreign officials to get mineral concessions in at least three African countries.

headline.print_headline: Adviser for Giant Fund Faces Bribery Charges Over Pursuit of Mining Rights in Africa
headline.main: Bribery Arrest May Expose African Mining Rights Scandal Tied to Och-Ziff

snippet: F.B.I. agents in Brooklyn arrested Samuel Mebiame, a consultant for an Och-Ziff Capital Management Group venture, on charges he paid bribes to African officials....
lead_paragraph: F.B.I. agents in Brooklyn arrested Samuel Mebiame, a consultant for an Och-Ziff Capital Management Group venture, on charges he paid bribes to African officials.
